activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karrie Ann Styer

defendant.name: Styer, Karrie Ann
defendant.address: 118 E North Lake St, Hancock, WI 54943

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

21CM280 & 22CM25 Cases called @ 10:51 AM Defendant Karrie Ann Styer appeared by phone.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Karrie Ann Styer.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to Vacate PPDA filed by the State. DA Leusink advises that the defendant has now obtained employment and they are requesting that the Court hold determination on the motion in abeyance until December to determine if the defendant has become compliant with the agreement. Atty Blankschein concurs with the State's request.
Request for Phone Appearance - Granted by the Court
Motion hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.

21CM280 & 22CM25 Cases called @ 9:31 AM Defendant Karrie Ann Styer appeared by phone.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Karrie Ann Styer. Defendant waives her right to be personally present in the courtroom. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Statement by ADA Kottke regarding the victim's request for restitution. 22CM25: $700 Restitution requested, 21CM280: Victim has requested $2685. The State is requesting that $1100 be ordered and the balance to be held in abeyance for a period of 30 days. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CM280 - NC. 22CM25: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and stays JOC. 22CM25: Ct 2 - Dismissed. Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 months. Statement by Atty Blankschein regarding the $75 administrative fee to the DA's Office. The Court adds to the PPDA that the victim reserves the right to request additional restitution and a restitution hearing.

Case called @ 1:33 PM Defendant Karrie Ann Styer appeared by phone.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein makes a special appearance by phone for Karrie Ann Styer. Defendant waives her right to be personally present in the courtroom. 22CM25 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered. Bond argument by DA Leusink. No objection by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $2000 Sig Bond.   P/S Scheduled - NOH Given. The Court will allow the defendant to appear by phone for the P/S hearing.   Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

22CM25 & 21CM280 Cases called @ 2:36 PM Defendant Karrie Ann Styer not in court. Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Karrie Ann Styer. Attorney Dennis Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is currently incarcerated in Pennsylvania. Atty Blankschein requests an adjournment to allow time for Atty Blankschein to be appointed on 22CM25.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
from DE regarding her custody status
